additionalTextInformation.text:
Joachim Mörlin was born on the 08.05.1514 in Wittenberg and died on the 29.05.1571 in Königsberg. He was 57 years of age when he died – as is stated on the painting. Koepplin assumes that this painting is a copy after an original version created by Lucas Cranach the Younger in 1571 and serves therefore as an imporrtant document. 

[Letter from D. Koepplin to the Meerbuscher Auktionshaus, 21.05.1975]

dating.remarks: [letter from D. Koepplin to the Meerbuscher Auktionshaus, 21.05.1975]

pageContext.description:
This small-scale copper panel shows a half-length portrait of Joachim Morlinus, Bishop of Wittenberg, against a neutral background with his gaze fixed on the viewer. He is wearing a black gown with a white ruffed shirt beneath. His greyish hair has thinned at the top, in contrast his beard is dark and full. He holds an edition of the bible [?] in his right hand, while pointing to it with the index finger of his left hand. An inscription above the sitter’s head reveals his identity and his age. 
[cda 2020]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 26.5 x 21 cm
[Auct. Cat. Düsseldorf 1975, 2-3, no. 20]
pageContext.inscription:
Inscription at the top left:
'IOACHIMVS MORLINVS WITBERGENSIS // THEOLOGIAE D. EPISCOPVS // AETATIS SVAE 57'
